metadata.title: CVE-2021-2032 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Information Schema). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.32 andprior and 8.0.22 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQL Server accessibledata. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.3 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).

criterions.comment: mysql-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mariadb-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
